definition: to write off at one stroke
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
pen/pencil/writing brush/to write or compose/the strokes of Chinese characters/classifier for sums of money, deals/CL:支[zhi1],枝[zhi1]
see 勾當|勾当[gou4 dang4]
surname Gou
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
to melt (metal)/to cancel or annul/to sell/to spend/to fasten with a bolt/bolt or pin

sentences.english: So no one should write this president or country off.
sentences.chinese: 因此不應對這位現任總統或國家一筆勾銷。

sentences.english: All past animosities are dead and buried now.
sentences.chinese: 過去所有的仇恨現在都一筆勾銷了。

sentences.english: In mysterious forest, father and son the write off of two pen of favour Chou Yi associate with.
sentences.chinese: 在神祕的森林中，父子倆將過往的恩仇一筆勾銷。

sentences.english: They hope he will wipe off all their debt.
sentences.chinese: 他們希望他把他們欠的債一筆勾銷。

sentences.english: Abruzzi: Take my duke so we can put all this abaft us.
sentences.chinese: 握手言跟，把以前的所有一筆勾銷吧。

sentences.english: Abruzzi: Take my hand so we can put all this behind us.
sentences.chinese: 握手言與，把以前的一切一筆勾銷吧。

sentences.english: His hopes of marrying her were paid to by her reply to his letter.
sentences.chinese: 她給他的覆信使他同她結婚的希望一筆勾銷。

definition: lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
wicked beyond redemption (idiom)/heinous
to mention sth without elaborating (idiom); not giving details
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to be reluctant to give up a post
inexperienced/junior (employee etc)
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
